[[Illinois State University]] ([[Bachelor of Arts|BA]]) |medium = Film, stand-up, television |website = {{URL|http://www.mrcraigrobinson.com}} |nationality = [[American nationality law|American]] |active = 2001–present }} '''Craig Phillip Robinson''' (born October 25, 1971) is an American actor, comedian, and singer. He is best known for his role as [[Darryl Philbin]] on ''[[The Office (U.S. TV series)|The Office]]'' (2005–2013) and has appeared in numerous other television shows and films including ''[[Pineapple Express (film)|Pineapple Express]]'' (2008), ''[[Zack and Miri Make a Porno]]'' (2008), ''[[Hot Tub Time Machine]]'' (2010), ''[[Brooklyn Nine-Nine]]'' (2013–), ''[[This Is the End]]'' (2013), and ''[[Sausage Party]]'' (2016). ==Early life== Robinson was born in [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]], to a music teacher mother and an attorney father.{{cite news| url=http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2009-03-11/news/0903110158_1_mug-chicago-roots-horace-mann | work=Chicago Tribune | title=5 questions for Craig Robinson | date=11 March 2009}}{{cite web|url=http://www.timeoutchicago.com/arts-culture/movies-on-demand/14733133/craig-robinson-on-the-office-interview |title=Craig Robinson on The Office | Interview |publisher=Timeoutchicago.com |date=2011-04-26 |accessdate=2015-01-29}} He was raised on the [[South Side of Chicago]], and was brought up [[Methodist]].{{cite web|url=http://www.dailynews.com/entertainment/ci_23404916/apocalypse-and-office-craig-robinson-ends-world-twice |title=Apocalypse and The Office: Craig Robinson ends the world. Twice |publisher=Dailynews.com |date= |accessdate=2015-01-29}} He attended [[Whitney M. Young Magnet High School]]. He received his undergraduate degree from [[Illinois State University]] in 1994, and his masters of education from [[Saint Xavier University]]. He was a music teacher at Horace Mann Elementary School in Chicago.{{cite web|title=Illinois State Alumni Magazine|url=http://advancement.illinoisstate.edu/news/downloads/Illinois-State-Alumni-Magazine-vol10no3.pdf|publisher=Illinois State University|volume=Winter 2009/2010 |page=29}} ==Career== ===Acting and comedy=== Robinson began doing stand-up and taking classes in improv and acting at [[The Second City]] in Chicago. Beginning in 2005, he portrayed [[Darryl Philbin]] on the American version of ''[[The Office (U.S. TV series)|The Office]]'', and was promoted to a starring role in the fourth season. He has appeared on other television shows, including ''[[Arrested Development (TV series)|Arrested Development]]'', ''[[Lucky (TV series)|Lucky]]'', ''[[Friends]]'', ''[[Halfway Home (TV series)|Halfway Home]]'', and ''[[Reno 911!]]''. He appeared in the [[music video]] for the [[Red Hot Chili Peppers]] song "[[Hump de Bump]]". He also hosted the seventh season of ''[[Last Comic Standing]]''. He voiced Cookie in ''[[Shrek Forever After]]'' (2010) and played Reg Mackworthy on the HBO hit series ''[[Eastbound & Down]]'' (2009–2012). Robinson is a frequent collaborator with [[Seth Rogen]], starring alongside Rogen in the films ''[[Knocked Up]]'' (2007), ''[[Pineapple Express (film)|Pineapple Express]]'' (2008), ''[[Zack and Miri Make a Porno]]'' (2008), ''[[This Is the End]]'' (2013) and ''[[Sausage Party]]'' (2016). He also appeared in what was then the highest grossing Korean film , "D-War" (Korean: 디워, released in North America as Dragon Wars: D-War.) Making a departure from his comedy background, Robinson portrayed saxophonist [[Maceo Parker]] in the [[James Brown]] biopic ''[[Get On Up (film)|Get On Up]]'' (2014). In December 2015, he appeared in several [[Wal-Mart]] commercials promoting their credit card while singing and playing the piano at the store.{{cite web|url=https://www.ispot.tv/ad/AA9G/walmart-credit-card-satchel-featuring-craig-robinson|title=Walmart Credit Card TV Commercial, 'Satchel' Featuring Craig Robinson|website=iSpot.tv}} He received rave reviews for the [[A24 (company)|A24]] drama ''[[Morris from America]]'' (2016),{{cite web|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/morris_from_america/|title=Morris From America (2016)|publisher=Rotten Tomatoes |accessdate=August 12, 2017}} earning a nomination for the [[Independent Spirit Award for Best Supporting Male]]. ===Music=== [[File:Craig Robinson 141001-A-QR427-487 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Robinson performing in 2014]] For a number of years, Robinson and comedian [[Jerry Minor]] had a comedy act where they performed as musical duo L. Witherspoon & Chucky, with Minor as smooth singing L. Witherspoon and Robinson as Chucky, the keyboard player and back-up singer. They performed the act on [[HBO]]'s ''Sketch Pad'', several stand-up shows on [[Comedy Central]], ''[[Real Time with Bill Maher]]'', and ''[[Jimmy Kimmel Live!]]''{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ty8BrKtk_u0 |title=L. Witherspoon & Chucky on Real Time |publisher=YouTube.com |date=2007-05-24 |accessdate=2015-01-29}} He occasionally performs with his band, The Nasty Delicious, alongside his brother [[Chris Rob]]. They were featured as his band in an episode of ''The Office'', and on the season finale of the seventh season of ''Last Comic Standing''. He has also performed in character in multiple episodes of ''The Office'', and was featured on the ''[[Hot Tub Time Machine]]'' soundtrack, singing "[[Jessie's Girl]]" and "[[Let's Get It Started]]." He was also in the film ''[[Miss March]]'', playing the role of the hit rapper Phil, also known as Horsedick.MPEG. Robinson produced two songs from that same film. ==Personal life== In June 2008, Robinson was arrested in [[Culver City, California]] for possession of [[MDMA]] and [[methamphetamine]].{{cite news|title='Office' actor Craig Robinson faces drug charges|url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/life/topstories/2008-08-15-119379010_x.htm|accessdate=27 November 2017|work=[[USA Today]]}} He was charged with two [[felonies]] but the charges were dismissed after he completed a [[diversion program]]. In October 2013, Robinson was arrested by the [[Royal Bahamas Police Force]] and fined $1,000 by a Bahamas court for possession of a half gram of [[marijuana]] and 18 MDMA pills.{{cite news|title='Office' actor Craig Robinson fined in minor drug bust|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/people/2013/10/10/actor-craig-robinson-in-minor-bahamas-drug-bust/2957887/|accessdate=27 November 2017|work=[[USA Today]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=October 13, 2013|language=en}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- !
